elements.label: list_item
elements.text: 3. Figure 3-10 shows the masks that are created in the HR_SCHEMA.

elements.label: picture
elements.text: Image showing column masks in System i Navigator

elements.label: caption
elements.text: Figure 3-10 Column masks shown in System i Navigator

elements.label: paragraph
elements.text: Now that you have created the row permission and the two column masks, RCAC must be activated. The row permission and the two column masks are enabled (last clause in the scripts), but now you must activate RCAC on the table. To do so, complete the following steps:

elements.label: list_item
elements.text: 1. Run the SQL statements that are shown in Example 3-10.

elements.label: section_header
elements.text: Example 3-10 Activating RCAC on the EMPLOYEES table

elements.label: code
list_item
elements.text: 2. Look at the definition of the EMPLOYEE table, as shown in Figure 3-11. To do this, from the main navigation pane of System i Navigator, click Schemas → HR_SCHEMA → Tables, right-click the EMPLOYEES table, and click Definition.

elements.label: picture
elements.text: Image showing selection of the EMPLOYEES table from System i Navigator

elements.label: caption
elements.text: Figure 3-11 Selecting the EMPLOYEES table from System i Navigator

elements.label: page_footer
elements.text: 28 Row and Column Access Control Support in IBM DB2 for i
